column4: anyone know of vmware server networking problems between host and guest?  running feisty.  tcp connections always hang.
how do you have the clients configured?  Bridge?
yeah, bridge.  ping works, but ssh doesn't, for example.  smb browsing works, but reaching shares doesn't!
i have been using vmware bridged networking for years so i know my services aren't misconfigured.  something funny is going on.
I recently had similar problem - turn out to be duplicate ip addresses. on host and client.  guess it wouldn't something as simple as that?
no, they got different addresses from my dhcp server.  in fact both host and guest have no problem connecting with other machines on the lan/internet.  only problems between eachother.
any other protocols work?  maybe an ssh setup issue?
doubt it. for example, i can ssh from my guest to another machine on the network, and then to the host.
they just have a problem with eachother.
Anyone with any exp. with getting a usb-headset working in feisty?  device is recognized, but no joy in anything i do in the alsa-base.  any suggestions?
does any other protocol work between host and client - http, ftp, etc.?  or is it just ssh?
hm, will have to check.
http hangs too.  ie, i connect to the host from the guest via http, and via tcpdump i can see the host sending back acks repeatedly but nothing happens.  yes http works fine from other hosts.
it's like the acks aren't getting to the guest
hm, just trying to rule out any network stuff first - any static routes, firewalls, etc?
nakin:  vmware forums also point to performance issues.
vmware forums also point to performance issues :http://www.vmware.com/community/thread.jspa?messageID=683286
may not apply to you
not that i know of.  i haven't touched my network settings, and this is a pretty fresh install of feisty.
it is a very new laptop though, so maybe it's a problem with the network driver.

sorry, new to ubuntu and vmware.  the only other thing I've heard about some other people doing is actually to setup a static route to the default router to get some of these host/clients issues resolved.
buy YMMV
but YMMV
